description: [Status: stable] [Name: percent-format-unsupported-format-character] [Message: %-format string has unsupported format character {char}] What it does Checks for printf-style format strings with invalid format characters. Why is this bad? In printf-style format strings, the % character is used to indicate placeholders. If a % character is not followed by a valid format character, it will raise a ValueError at runtime. Example "Hello, %S" % "world" Use instead: "Hello, %s" % "world"
